description: Borrowed from Marathi चाळ (cāḷ), from Sanskrit. Doublet of cell.

entries.meaning: A type of residential tenement building found in India, typically for poor working-class people.
examples: Dhirubhai Ambani's first home in Mumbai was nearly as humble as the ones the gawking labourers inhabit: a pigeonhole chawl four kilometres from Antilia, in the pushcart-clogged trading neighbourhood of Bhuleshwar.
